meanings.definition: A loud cry or exclamation of pain or excitement.
meanings.sent1: When he stubbed his toe, a yeow escaped his lips.
meanings.sent2: The yeow of the crowd filled the stadium after the winning goal.
meanings.sent3: The cat let out a yeow when it saw its reflection in the mirror.
meanings.sent4: The yeow of the thunder echoed through the valley.
meanings.sent5: Her yeow of joy could be heard from across the room.

meanings.definition: To make a loud cry or exclamation.
meanings.sent1: She yeowed in pain when she touched the hot pan.
meanings.sent2: The child yeowed loudly when he fell off his bike.
meanings.sent3: The puppy yeowed playfully as it chased its tail.
meanings.sent4: The wind yeowed through the trees on the stormy night.
meanings.sent5: He yeowed with excitement as he opened his birthday present.

meanings.definition: An expression of surprise or disbelief.
meanings.sent1: Yeow! I can't believe you did that!
meanings.sent3: Yeow, did you see the size of that fish?
meanings.sent4: Yeow! The magician made the rabbit disappear!
meanings.sent5: Yeow, what a fantastic magic trick!
